qas.question: What caused Eisenhower to kickstart the US space program?
Along with the U-2 flyovers, what did Eisenhower try to legitimize with the Open Skies Policy?
What was the legal status of the U-2 flyovers?
What was the name of the civilian space agency created by Eisenhower?
With whom did Eisenhower try to improve relations?

context: On the whole, Eisenhower's support of the nation's fledgling space program was officially modest until the <a0_0>Soviet launch of Sputnik<a0_0/> in 1957, gaining the Cold War enemy enormous prestige around the world. He then launched a national campaign that funded not just space exploration but a major strengthening of science and higher education. His Open Skies Policy attempted to legitimize <a2_0>illegal<a2_0/> Lockheed U-2 flyovers and <a1_0>Project Genetrix<a1_0/> while paving the way for spy satellite technology to orbit over sovereign territory, created <a3_0>NASA<a3_0/> as a civilian space agency, signed a landmark science education law, and fostered improved relations with <a4_0>American scientists<a4_0/>.
